result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 09/13/22
- 3 days against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: each count without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation Revocation

8:00 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Scott Allen Driscoll in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Scott Allen Driscoll.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF310, 22TR1280, & 22TR1958.  ADA Becker recites joint agreement and states there will be a DJOC for 2 years in 22CF310. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety (DJOC), G to Ct 4- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, & G to Ct 5- Operate Firearm While Intoxicated in 22CF310.  DE pleads G to Ct 1- OWI 1st in 22TR1280. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 4, & 5 in 22CF310 and guilty to Ct 1 in 22TR1280. Court withholds sentence in favor of DJOC on Ct 1 in 22CF310 for 2 years and requests the Diversion Program to provide quarterly updates regarding DE's compliance. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses with prejudice Ct 2, 3, & 6 in 22CF310 and merge and dismiss 22TR1958.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 4 in 22CF310

S/W 2 Years Probation is concurrent on each count without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $243.00     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
Apply bond on file, balance to be paid through probation

Court Orders: Ct 5 in 22CF310

S/W 2 Years Probation is concurrent on each count without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $243.00

Conditions of Probation:

- AODA and follow through 
- Absolute sobriety
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Do not obtain illegal substances and prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Anger management assessment and follow through
- No contact with Travis B.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Justice Support program and complete victim impact panel
- 60 days county jail- STAYED.  To be used by probation if necessary
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by today 9/13/22

3 days credit against ultimate sentence

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.J.Bacholke. or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- No possession of firearms

- Must surrender firearms to St Croix County Sheriff's Department within 24 hours of release

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF310 & 22TR1280 (INIT):
